post.body: Wonderful chap… All of them.
Thanks! Much appreciated.
Ah... I was just about to send this link to you when you asked. http://www.famousbirthdays.com/
But the day before today (the 16th) is Arthur C. Clarke, Margaret Mead, Beethoven, Jane Austen…
Not many of note. Sharing the day with me is Mike Mills (of REM (50)), Bill Pullman (actor (55)), and Arthur Fieldler (conductor)
Douglas Fraser, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, Rob Van Dam, Ossie Davis, Ty Cobb, Earl "DMX" Simmons, and as you know Steven Spielberg
Others sharing your day (18th) include Keith Richards, Brad Pitt, Betty Grable, Leonard Maltin, Christina Aguilera, Katie Holmes,…
Money aside, when I wore a younger man's clothes, I thought I would be in the same feild as he at this point in my life. Sigh.
I wouldn't mind if our bank accounts resembled each other. Yeah, it's more than just a day for me to catch up with him.
I know. All the cool people wind up having it on the 18th. You share it with Steven Spielberg for example.
Thanks. It's hard to believe it is here again already. It's official for my time zone now.
Wow. I am honoured. Thanks for staying up late, I am sure partying and celebrating my birthday. You've paved the way for me! Thanks!
Thanks (still in advance here by a little more than an hour now).
But if it were not for Troughton's success as the second Doctor, it may have ended altogether there in the 1960's.
I know, I was busting your chops a bit. Hartnell should not had come in last. I agree.
I had hit the tweet reply icon in Twhirl for you and didn't realize it when I went to reply to someone else. Sorry Mark.
Sorry, that last tweet wasn't meant for you. LOL.
@wookiejedi Umm... yeah. Remind me not to invite you to my parties. LOL.
Don't bash on Troughton. (re: The Chronic Rift - Ep. Two). Even though there's so little complete eps, he is still outstanding.
But I know what that tweet was really in reference to though.
Since cyborg technology was common in the Star Wars universe, I wouldn't be surprise if there were some Cyberwookiees.
I am sure most feel the same way about it.
Interesting. It's kind of odd visioning it now if they had went with him.
So I guess the 7th Doctor had sonic spoons too.
Even though he's not British?
Nope, Batman (the Adam West TV series) debuted in 1966. It was all color.
Oh? Where?
I forgot about the Confidential until I got to the end credits. I'll have to take another flight later for that.
A better solution would be Gizmo. It is free and you can do it via the Talkshoe SIP address.
The live show is scheduled for 1:30 pm EST (US) (6:30 pm GMT). Let's hope it goes smoother than last time.
Cool.
Join us on Sunday if you can.
Thanks.
I had to re-add 4/5th of the water back into the pond due to what happened. Thankfully it thawed out quickly over the last 2 days.
I am finally give TweetDeck a spin.
RT @gwensdad: 10 doctors (disco) dancing: http://tinyurl.com/83qhaw
It's after midnight here, so it is Boxing Day now. Happy Boxing Day!
I need to re-watch "The Next Doctor" again, this time alone & without all the holiday interruptions. We'll review it Sun on the live podcast
Just learned the news about Eartha Kitt passing away. http://tinyurl.com/7qst24
Gifts are finally wrapped. Not many this year unfortunately, but still.. Remind to shoot whoever started this tradition of wrapping gifts.
